title: Xin Zhao - help wanted
body:
kinda struggling to make an impact as xin at the moment. Have had a string of pretty average games which I have not been able to positively impact.

my build is bruiser but I tend to rush damage items first and build tank late game.

looking for tips from Xin mains on how to improve my gameplay.

replies.body:
Max Q first, then W, then E

Before engaging head on, do this:

E into target, Q AND W BOTH @ SAME TIME!
If your trying to single out people in team fights, make sure you ult, so same combo accept before doing Q and W, do ulti.
Build devourer because your W passive gives you health every third health.
If you gonna be yoloing then make sure you hav nashors tooth {{item:3115}}, because your W passive is based on AP scaling, instead of ad.

Do remember you can build tank and ad!

If your still unsure of wtf i just talked about then just watch Mulan, skip all the crap and go to when Mulan has her first training session with the new Commander. Or go straight to the part that has the song, 'Be a Man'. Because, Xin Zhao I honestly think came from that FUKING movie.

Yeah....

Good luck anyway in the fields of Justice....

Maxing E first is almost always better than Q. This is such a common mistake people seem to make on Xin. Each extra point in Q gives you 45 more damage(if you land all 3 hits) and E gives an extra 40 so is basically equivalent damage-wise. Reducing the cooldown on your gap closing ability is significantly more useful though(plus the slow gets slightly better), especially when your early game is so strong. Having Q come off cd a couple seconds earlier will usually be irrelevant since the guy will already be out of aa range by then and you can't use it a second time anyway.

Not super experienced with Xin lately (hell not even a jungle main) but been meddling in normals a bit and an interesting thing I've found is to actually mix up when you use your E to engage.

When lets say mid lane is extended and you show up they'll be expected the E engage, what I like to do is just run straight at them for a couple of seconds first. If they have dashes/escapes they sometimes panic and use them (or flash if you're lucky) and THEN you can just E in to catch. Also because your engage tool is on such a low cooldown Xin seems great for going into a lane blowing some of their abilities/items, wander out like you're going back to jungle then just come straight back in if they push back up.

EDIT: but like I said, not a greatly experienced jungler so someone correct me if I'm off on anything please!

The build mentioned would give good sustain/damage/defence, or you go yolo and 1 hit their adc as full ad (sated allows faster healing from w, faster cd resets and pretty much instant knockups on your target, making removing the adc in a teamfight easier for your team).

using e r q+w on the enemy adc usually allows you to eliminate the enemy adc before their team can recuperate from the stun, and makes you tankier because of the bonus defense off of hitting their entire team with r, for a max total of 125 armor and magic resist bonus.

gave it a run tonight, and focussed my build path on devourer, then hydra, THEN botrk and tank items. Made a big difference. 12/5/17. Will try it again to make sure it wasnt a once off.
Haven't been able to consistently replicate that score just yet but changing build order has definitely had an impact on my game presence.

lot of people here saying devourer but then your mid game goes out the window. you better hope you pulled off a lot of early ganks, which is my biggest tip. who needs attack speed when you have an auto reset and an atk speed boost already....you pretty much should kill anyone pre-6 in 2-3 autos after Q combo, with your laner/s, and devourer (non-sated, and nerfed) isnt gonna help anymore than warrior (instant early game armour pen, CDR, buffed) in the early game or cinderhulk in the late game
